required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nimotuzumab Combined With Chemoradiotherapy Versus Chemoradiotherapy for Local Advanced Cervical Squamous Cell Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: To Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of Nimotuzumab Combined With Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy Versus Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy in the Treatment of Local Advanced Cervical Squamous Cell Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the efficacy and safety of nimotuzumab combined with concurrent chemoradiotherapy versus concurrent chemoradiotherapy in the treatment of local advanced cervical squamous cell carcinoma.

detailed_description.textblock: This study adopts a multi-center, randomized controlled, open-label clinical trial design.

primary_outcome.description: The rate of patient without progress disease in 3 years after treatment

secondary_outcome.description: The rate of patient alive in 3 years after treatment
Percentage of subjects in this group who achieve complete response by imaging assessment from the end of treatment to disease progression.
The percentage of patients who experienced complete or partial cancer shrinkage or disappearance after treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of acute adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Number and grade of participants with adverse events

arm_group.description: Patients receive nimotuzumab combined with cisplatin and undergo external-beam radiation and brachytherapy.
Patients receive cisplatin and undergo external-beam radiation and brachytherapy

intervention.description: Patients receive Nimotuzumab 400 mg each time, once a week, slow intravenous drip, for a total of 6 weeks.
Patients receive 40 mg/m2, d1, 7 days as 1 treatment cycle, 6 treatment cycles in total
Patients undergo IMRT/VMAT radiotherapy with pelvic and/or extended field irradiation at a total dose of 45 - 50.4 Gy; 1.8 - 2.0 Gy/f, 25 - 28 f.

Patient undergo Brachytherapy with high dose rate, with a total dose of 30-40 Gy and a cumulative dose of 80 ~ 85 Gy at point A/HRCTV D90; if the tumor diameter is ≥ 4 cm, the cumulative dose of ≥ 87 Gy at point A/HRCTV D90.
